meanings.sent1: The campfire began to crepitate as the wood crackled and popped.
meanings.sent2: I love it when bacon starts to crepitate in the frying pan.
meanings.sent3: The old radio crepitated like a bowl of Rice Krispies.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air seemed to crepitate with energy.
meanings.sent5: The autumn leaves crepitated under our feet as we walked through the forest.

meanings.definition: To make a series of short, sharp noises.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks crepitated in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
meanings.sent2: The old floorboards crepitated under our weight as we walked through the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The bubble wrap crepitated loudly as the kids jumped on it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter crepitated through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The hailstones crepitated against the window, creating a rhythmic beat.
